Title: Getting Started
Description: Learn the basics of the MTM WIP Application.

Topics.Title: Application Overview
Topics.Summary: Introduction to the main features and interface.
Topics.Content:
Welcome to MTM WIP Application

{{component:alert type="info"}}This documentation has been updated for version 6.4.0.1.{{/component:alert}}

This application helps you track Work In Progress (WIP) inventory, manage transactions, and generate reports.

Key Features

  • Real-time Inventory: Track parts, locations, and quantities instantly.
  • Barcode Scanning: Use scanners for fast and accurate data entry.
  • Infor Visual Integration: Seamlessly sync data with the ERP system.
  • Customizable Interface: Choose themes and shortcuts that work for you.

Example Code

{{component:code language="csharp"}}// Example of how to use the API var result = await Dao_Inventory.GetAllAsync();{{/component:code}}

Topics.Title: Logging In
Topics.Summary: How to access the system securely.
Topics.Content:
Logging In

The application uses your Windows credentials or a specific Employee ID for authentication.

  1. Launch the application.
  2. If prompted, enter your Employee ID or scan your badge.
  3. The system will load your user profile, including your saved theme and shortcut preferences.

Topics.Title: Navigating the Interface
Topics.Summary: Understanding the main tabs and controls.
Topics.Content:
Main Interface

The application is organized into tabs for different workflows:

  • Inventory (Ctrl+1): The main dashboard for viewing and managing current stock.
  • Remove (Ctrl+2): Process inventory removal transactions.
  • Transfer (Ctrl+3): Move inventory between locations.
  • Settings: Configure application preferences.

Quick Access

Use the Quick Buttons panel on the right side of the screen for one-click access to common actions. These can also be triggered using Function keys (F1-F10).

Topics.Title: Using the Help System
Topics.Summary: How to find answers and documentation.
Topics.Content:
Accessing Help

You can access this help system at any time by pressing F1.

  • Search: Use the search bar at the top left to find specific topics.
  • Browse: Navigate through categories using the sidebar.
  • Context Help: Many screens have specific help shortcuts (e.g., Ctrl+F1 for Getting Started).
